embeds.title: It's a Feature
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_auto: / The Automaton / Downfall

 (**Innate**.)
Whenever you draw a **Curse** or **Status** card, gain 1 temporary :p_temp: **Strength** :p_strength: and **Dexterity** :p_dexterity:.

messages.content: Bethesda
Uhhh honestly I don't play auto, little over status auto enough to have a formulated opinion on this card

This card is stealthily one of the most powerful scaling things that the Automaton can do, alongside Bug Barrage+ and Buggy Mess. If you get enough card draw (which is easily possible with Bug Barrage+ and the power that draws 3 on cast then 1 per turn and insert a Daze) you can be getting lots and lots of Str and Dex; but the secret to really going wild with it then is Bronze Armor or other repeatable source of artifact. I have won many Neow fights with 20+ permanent strength and dex. 

Even if it's just temporary and you never get the artifact to lock it in, the synergy with Bug Barrage+'s multi hit can blow up hallway enemies real fast.

You don't usually want to pick this first before you have the Buggy Messes or Bug Barrage+s, but you can if you have appropriate upcoming enemies like Ironclad 1 or the Defect that gives you Voids.

You hardly ever need more than 1 of this, or to upgrade it, since it's a scaling strategy. It took me a long time to stumble into the combos with this - at first Bug Barrage looked unpickable to me (and it still kinda sucks without the +) - and if you're not comboing with it and using "fairly" it is pretty bad.

Yeah the innate upgrade is worse than unupgraded. There are very few cards that shuffle statuses into your draw pile, most either put them in your hand or discard so you don't draw them until at the earliest second cycle, when you'd already have drawn this.
afaik there is 0 ways to add statuses to your deck, the closest is mark of pain: an ironclad exclusive boss relic.
This is just another example of innate powers just being bad. Most of the powers that actually would benefit from it would be too strong with it.
<automaton draw 3 power>

At the start of each turn, draw 1 additional card and **Insert** 1 Dazed.

messages.content: Almost every auto status card is insert
Innate is actually ok
Oh I stand corrected
In my opinion of all those, only buggy mess and max output are really good
I'm not certain whether innate on this is an upgrade or downgrade, probably it depends
I am curious about what people say about this card, as I kinda want to rework it with other **Status** related payoffs that Auto has.
I wish that the payoff was better with artifact.
I can draw a bunch of statuses with a well played bug barrage, and have an artifact, and only get 1 strength out of it.
So I just make big iron waves. Which is insanely boring.
The whole concept of the character being "make custom cards" falls apart when doing anything other than "make big iron waves" isn
t anywhere near as good
there's no "synergies", just "get x block do x damage get a blur do some other random bs"
I wasn't expecting to see feedback on Auto in general, but I am listening.
strength dumping is incredibly boring when the card says do damage three times in the same card too

and functions don't feel unique, and I don't really feel like I'm playing as the boss in the first place. When I think of the automaton, I think of cycle based buffs, powerful attacks with huge drawbacks, and card manipulation. Functions are cool for the first few runs, but on later ascensions, especially A20, doing "cool things" with functions simply doesn't exist and you are more or less gluing random effects together. Furthermore, statuses have some powerful cards, but not many cross archetype interactions. There's buggy mess and oil spill.... and that's really just it.

I like characters that have really unique mechanics, and while automaton SEEMS unique on the surface, it's mostly just a bunch of effects from vanilla, but there's three of them. This can be strong, but I rarely ever find that I have to use intuition to make functions that play well, which I what I would want in a character where the main gimmick is custom cards.
I WANT to be forced to think
AND I want that thinking to be rewarded with unique effects.
that's basically my thoughts on the character as a whole

Hmm... I will tell you something, our ideas for what to do with Functions in the future, are mostly based around us trying to nerf them, as they are currently way too strong in providing both frontload __and__ scaling, but it would also effectively sanitize them as a result.

That said I never considered some stuff that you mention, as the goal was to improve balance of the character, but I never considered how the **Function** mechanic might feel as a whole, and what new player might expect out of the Automaton.
I do think functions deserve a nerf but I also want unique effects from them.
Instead you have <safeguard>

messages.content: etc etc
Yeah, it will be changed, but there won't be much of an improvement when it comes to identity.
On the other hand, I have a problem with trying to put **Scry** on every Automaton card.
I feel as if the identity is lacking right now in the character
it lacks the flavor of slime boss, guardian, hexaghost, and champ

About scry, I don't really see how it would fit on the character. A lucky-esque card is just another iron wave type card, and multiple sources of scry already exist such as <automaton scry 6 rare encode>

embeds.title: Assembly
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 1 :energy_auto: / The Automaton / Downfall

**Scry** 5 (8).
**Encode** all Encodable cards discarded (in selected order).
**Exhaust**.

messages.content:
It is because unlike these characters Auto has 2 very big packages (+ some general utility), instead of many smaller ones that also interact with eachother.
 And that situation is caused by the fact that current **Encode** needs to be a big portion of the card pool to work.

It is mostly a result of trying to give character necessary tools to do what I want the character to do, while keeping it balanced, as draw is extremely powerful on Auto, so we need an alternative for it, that said we also want Auto's **Status** decks work by keeping the **Status** cards, so **Scry** is the best  way to achieve that, while it also provides some deck manipulation which makes setting up combos easier.
why not a weaker version of evolve?
:watcherthink:
<altar templar>
hmmmm
perhaps it could exhaust a status and draw a card, as if the status is being "repulsed"
Because then it is just 1 card, and I don't like making a major build working on a single card, because then you end up with catch 22 situation where you only end up with a build if you force it.
well that card exhausted the first status or curse you drew each turn and gave a glyph that gave 5 block as a quick explanation
it's a bit more complicated than that
and the character had no status generation
and bug barrage still exists to serve a similar purpose
but bug barrage is also the payoff at the same time
I have complicated feeling about bug barrage, it is both the enabler and the payoff.
And it's common I think?
Generally we are terrified of **Bug Barrage**, as it just does too much, and it is a common card.
what if it was uncommon and exhausted any statuses drawn
serving as both clean up and forcing you to have more status gen

My current idea for a reworked version:
> Deal 5(7) damage.
> Draw 2 cards.
> Deal 5(7) damage per every **Status** drawn this way.
I think the fact that it creates statuses is the main problem
I would compare this to <pommel strike> in a way.
Then it would just be a card that **Exhausts** **Status** cards, which is the opposite of what we want Auto to do, and we want that because it is a different approach from what Ironclad is doing.
i feel there should be greater consideration on reworks like this when you take a really fun mechanic of a card away
flowcharts aren't fun
yes, the current implementation is too powerful, but are you absolutely certain it must be scrapped entirely?
im talking about bug barrage specifically, not auto
can we talk about goto
because you talked about draw
and the draw is right there
it's draw 4 ish?

oh and I think headbutt fits the idea of automaton, but obviously, it's alot for them. But the whole "bronze orb trapping a card" is basically just a headbutt. even if it's too much because of how functions work right now
reminder to allow stanek time to respond
Yeah I somewhat agree on the overall feel of functions just being a few basic cards glued together.
sorry I'm just saying words into an endless void just 'cause
I talk a lot

I think overall it's not the worst character balance-wise, and it can be fun, but it doesn't really feel like it needs nor commands intentional play. You can just play anything that says "encode" that doesn't have a major downside, then play functions and probably be fine for most runs as auto.
The ways I can see encode/function being fixed... all of them would be pretty big reworks to the character as a whole

The easiest (also my least favorite) would be to just make functions cost 2 energy. Most of them would probably still be pretty well playable tbh, but I think it would make them a lot less enjoyable. Would definitely be the easiest "fix" though.
making functions cost 2 would obliterate the starter relic

Current **Bug Barrage** is too much, which creates problems when it comes to designing other **Status** synergies, as it basically warps the entire deck around itself, and only worked in **Status** decks, which was pretty weird for a Common, as they are usually cards that may or may not be a part of a build but rarely define it, and I prefer to reduce a potential of a card in exchange for making it more pickable, adding synergizies, and in turn options for the players.

Next would be just overall reducing numbers on encode cards to about 2/3 of what they are and hope that it's at least balanced. I still don't think it would fix the fundamental problems the character has though, and could leave the character in a similar situation to where champ is, which I'd prefer to not be there.

> pretty weird for a Common
i mean, why not add it to uncommon then
bug barrage is status, and status is bug barrage
the whole status archetype is built upon it
by the way, conversations like these are why we need community members to be dedicated character experts
very subtle evab
the more expertise someone has on a single character, the more they can help shape the direction of future changes in a positive way
next patch notes : guardian now has a common that deals 99999 damage
jk
we already got that
strike for strike
lol
kek
either way I feel as if multiple people are necessary, while one person can have a sense for balance the more they play, multiple perspectives are better

3rd would be to rework most encode cards to have weirder effects, and not a lot of outright block/attack. This would take a lot of cards to be reworked, but it would lead to functions being a bit more niche and less all-encompassing, and avoid the "big iron wave" problem. It would mean that the rest of auto would need to pick up the slack on getting damage/block though.
oh, i don't mean that at all

We experimented with it, and it just killed the sliver of fun that playing a function had, we also tried making them **Exhaust** but that would force us to reduce amount of text that a card can add to a Function from 2 to 1 line which wasn't really useful, but it showed us that there is a direction where we can go, and reduce amount of **Encode** cards overall.
I think a small emount of encode cards increases the value of replicate

its obligated to be there, but....

just at least one person dedicated enough to really mastering a character in and out - there can be more than one of them, and they don't have to restrict themselves to just that character either, just dedication to a full mastery

The last function rework idea I have which I'll share again that I stole from *someone* I don't remember who

Playing an encode card encodes a copy of said card instead of itself, and functions exhaust.

So basically everything acts like it was <merge conflict>'d and <backtrace>'d

 And it kinda needs to be a Common to work.

Yeah I imagined the character would have an archetype similar to tackles, but instead of just damage it is various effects (mostly debuffs)
and having a debuff package similar to hermit's
tbh downsides on automaton would probably lean towards statuses
I guess that initial concept evolved into statuses.

Honestly I like the current state of Automaton, I think it's my 2nd favorite Downfall class, and I enjoy the "staple my cards together" core fantasy. I think maybe the Bug Barrage+ deck is too strong in the abstract but I don't have a real  problem with it.

embeds.title: StS Downfall: The Claw of Automaton
embeds.description:
Oil Spill is the self-scaling card for the card-combining evil modded character, The Automaton. Encoded cards go into 1 of 3 slots above the character, and once all 3 are filled it combines them into 1 card with the abilities of all three cards. Can be lots of fun.

This video is edited to remove long periods of nothing happening, and also to re...

messages.content: ||i should make a thumbnail for this 🤔||
clawtomaton?

It's like how, eg, Slime Boss tackles generally don't work. You can take them, and they have an effect, and are maybe "fine enough", but are several tiers in power down from other plans the character can have
Maybe you take one early because you are desperate to beat an act 1 elite and start snowballing
Which I think is fine for a damage common
It's fine for that point on the power spectrum to exist, goodness knows it does in the base game
Downfall power level is high, and the events give you more power, plus more removes, so the Skip button is even better in Downfall than base game
(To be clear I remain a fan of somewhat overpowered things and making the player feel strong)
Anyways I think automaton is good and the mod contributors should feel good

So, my opinion on **It's a Feature**:
 The card works, but it is probably one of the most awkward ways for a Power to work, as it generally wants you to draw as many Status cards as possible, but it also doesn't do anything if you only draw **Status** cards, in fact you need to be able to spend your whole Energy gained on a turn to make **It's a Feature** worth playing it, so in result it only works in decks that focus on playing the **Bug Barrage**, which makes it pretty underwhelming especially since it is a Power card, that is a conditional **Inflame** or **Footwork**, depending on what other cards you draw can do.
 Only thing that saves it is absurd **Strength** and **Dex** scaling that Auto has.
It has bad interactions with artifact.
but it's okay for a 1 cost, I guess
it's better than speedrunning on hexaghost I guess

The most that I can say here is that I haven't really had the opportunity to play the "status deck" for automaton. The power level and density of cards for the function spam deck are so high that I always seem to get pushed towards that direction by what I'm seeing, and I try to play the run I'm in and use what I'm seeing. By that time that I see a copy of it's a feature, It usually just feels like trying to draft around it would get in the way of the function spam stuff that I'm already doing, because those decks really want to trim down to have a very powerful second cycle, and playing status stuff will get in the way of that. It's very unusual to find an opportunity to do something other than function spam on automaton, it's just such an overrepresented playstyle within their cardpool.

On a theoretical level, this card should be possible to take without much support, as plenty of enemies shuffle statuses into your deck, and both act 4 fights put curses in (plus your starting ascenders bane). Buggy mess and bug barrage, and max output are all reasonable support for this, as well as the other various cards that insert statuses. Temporary strength and dexterity as a payoff is pretty weird, considering that you just drew multiple "dead" cards in order to enable it, and so probably won't be able to benefit much from the stats. Artifact doesn't work very well with this, even when you are drawing multiple statuses, but orange pellets is absolutely nuts. You would want to pair it with card draw in order to get more procs, and to find more "real" cards that can benefit from the stats.

Kind of funny against tri-sentries, but doesn't do very much against nob and lagavulin unless you somehow already have a very status heavy deck. Very good with snecko eye to draw more cards. Functions do benefit significantly from both the strength and dex, but the statuses getting in the way is a nonbo. Very situational upgrade, you really want anchor or bag of prep before using it.
very low bar to be fair
hexaghost is not a gamer
literally all you need to do to fix speedrunning is to make it work on the end of turn advance
now it's a weird inflame
instead of whatever it is now
Yeah maybe bring it back to 1 cost. I'd rather it be that, with 1(0) cost than innate, but I also hate innate power upgrades and will actively seek out their removal
as an increasingly hermit player, have you upgraded determination yet
I actually haven't taken it recently surprisingly.
I really wanted it in my last run but never saw it (early horseshoe, late incense as well)

unga bunga card that lets you take every bug barrage you see and steamroll the game. The other cards that interact with status are quite strong as well and you can take the boss card last stand to remove the temporary debuffs and make them permanent.

this card also can be good for snecko if you can set up a semi infinite since it can give you a ton of strength that you can then use too kill an enemy with a 0 cost attack in one shot. Of course if you have a real infinite too then this card works there too.
lmao "good on snecko" aka ??? (can muddle the cost and make draw, meaning wait until it gets to 0 cost and play it)
the best snecko cards are usually high cost cards, or powers that activate during a turn when a condition is met

what I mean is you can do something like have exotic form, a discard card and loop your deck to draw your ascensionders bane to keep getting temporary strength until you can one shot the enemy. The benefit of this is you get need infinite card draw and a little bit of energy which is much easier to achieve then an infinite that needs card draw, energy and damage. Plus you can easily draw like 30 cards turn even without an infinite, so if you have drawn your accender's bane (or any status card the enemy gives you) 3 times you get 3 temporary strength and dex which is good value.
its probably not very good for normal snecko because you don't want to select automation very often though
I more meant that snecko, especially in late game, has literally 0 cohesion whatsoever, so it's hard to really say what's "good" when everything has a randomized cost and draws
